<<<api>>>: Cipher.init
<<<code>>>: /* Encrypt the message. */
Cipher cipher = Cipher.getInstance("AES/CTR/NoPadding");
cipher.init(Cipher.ENCRYPT_MODE, secretKey, new IvParameterSpec(iv));
byte[] ciphertext = cipher.update(plaintext.getBytes(StandardCharsets.UTF_8));
/* Decrypt the message. */
Cipher cipher = Cipher.getInstance("AES/CTR/NoPadding");
cipher.init(Cipher.DECRYPT_MODE, secretKey, new IvParameterSpec(iv));
byte[] decryptedText = cipher.update(ciphertext);
String plaintext = new String(decryptedText, StandardCharsets.UTF_8);
<<<explanation>>>: In CTR mode, the encryption and decryption processes are the same. You can use the Cipher.update method to encrypt or decrypt partial blocks of data. In your case, you can call Cipher.update with the available data from the TCP socket to get the encrypted or decrypted data. The Cipher.update method will return the processed data immediately, even if it doesn't have a full 16-byte block. You can then process the received data and continue reading from the TCP socket.
